metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: XML DOM Tutorial
What is the DOM?
The DOM defines a standard for accessing and manipulating documents:
content.html: The DOM defines a standard for accessing and manipulating documents:

content.text: "The W3C Document Object Model (DOM) is a platform and language-neutral interface that allows programs and scripts to dynamically access and update the content, structure, and style of a document."
content.html: "The W3C Document Object Model (DOM) is a platform and language-neutral interface that allows programs and scripts to dynamically access and update the content, structure, and style of a document."

content.text: The HTML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating HTML documents. It presents an HTML document as a tree-structure.
content.html: The HTML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating HTML documents. It presents an HTML document as a tree-structure.

content.text: The XML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating XML documents. It presents an XML document as a tree-structure.
content.html: The XML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating XML documents. It presents an XML document as a tree-structure.

content.text: Understanding the DOM is a must for anyone working with HTML or XML.
content.html: Understanding the DOM is a must for anyone working with HTML or XML.

content.text: The HTML DOM
All HTML elements can be accessed through the HTML DOM.
content.html: All HTML elements can be accessed through the HTML DOM.

content.text: This example changes the value of an HTML element with id="demo":
content.html: This example changes the value of an HTML element with id="demo":

content.code: This is a Heading
content.code_html:
<h1 id="demo">This is a Heading</h1>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Hello World!";
</script>

content.text: This example changes the value of the first <h1> element in an HTML document:
content.html: This example changes the value of the first <h1> element in an HTML document:

content.code:
This is a Heading

This is a Heading
content.code_html:
<h1>This is a Heading</h1>

<h1>This is a Heading</h1>

<script>
document.getElementsByTagName("h1")[0].innerHTML = "Hello World!";
</script>

content.text: Note: Even if the HTML document contains only ONE <h1> element you still have to specify the array index [0], because the getElementsByTagName() method always returns an array.
content.html: Note: Even if the HTML document contains only ONE <h1> element you still have to specify the array index [0], because the getElementsByTagName() method always returns an array.

content.text: You can learn a lot more about the HTML DOM in our JavaScript tutorial .
content.html: You can learn a lot more about the HTML DOM in our JavaScript tutorial.

content.text: The XML DOM
All XML elements can be accessed through the XML DOM.
content.html: All XML elements can be accessed through the XML DOM.

content.text: The XML DOM is:
content.html: The XML DOM is:

content.text: In other words: The XML DOM is a standard for how to get, change, add, or delete XML elements.
content.html: In other words: The XML DOM is a standard for how to get, change, add, or delete XML elements.

content.text: Get the Value of an XML Element
This code retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in an XML document:
content.html: This code retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in an XML document:

content.code_html: txt = xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("title")[0].childNodes[0].nodeValue;

content.text: Loading an XML File
The XML file used in the examples below is books.xml .
content.html: The XML file used in the examples below is books.xml.

content.text: This example reads "books.xml" into xmlDoc and retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in books.xml:
content.html: This example reads "books.xml" into xmlDoc and retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in books.xml:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
var xhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();
xhttp.onreadystatechange = function() {
    if (this.readyState == 4 && this.status == 200) {
    myFunction(this);
    }
};
xhttp.open("GET", "books.xml", true);
xhttp.send();

function myFunction(xml) {
    var xmlDoc = xml.responseXML;
    document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML =
    xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("title")[0].childNodes[0].nodeValue;
}
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example Explained
Loading an XML String
This example loads a text string into an XML DOM object, and extracts the info from it with JavaScript:
content.html: This example loads a text string into an XML DOM object, and extracts the info from it with JavaScript:

content.code_html:
<html>
<body>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
var text, parser, xmlDoc;

text = "<bookstore><book>" +
"<title>Everyday Italian</title>" +
"<author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>" +
"<year>2005</year>" +
"</book></bookstore>";

parser = new DOMParser();
xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(text,"text/xml");

document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML =
xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("title")[0].childNodes[0].nodeValue;
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Programming Interface
The DOM models XML as a set of node objects. The nodes can be accessed with JavaScript or other programming languages. In this tutorial we use JavaScript.
content.html: The DOM models XML as a set of node objects. The nodes can be accessed with JavaScript or other programming languages. In this tutorial we use JavaScript.

content.text: The programming interface to the DOM is defined by a set standard properties and methods.
content.html: The programming interface to the DOM is defined by a set standard properties and methods.

content.text: Properties are often referred to as something that is (i.e. nodename is "book").
content.html: Properties are often referred to as something that is (i.e. nodename is "book").

content.text: Methods are often referred to as something that is done (i.e. delete "book").
content.html: Methods are often referred to as something that is done (i.e. delete "book").

These are some typical DOM properties:
content.html: These are some typical DOM properties:

content.html: Note: In the list above, x is a node object.
